Reviews.Title: “Revisiting a nice place”
Reviews.Author: cpsimons
Reviews.Content: The last time I was at this hotel was two years ago. It remains a favorite of mine, as I like the KuDamm zone very much - much more than Berlin-Mitte. Here there are a lot of trees and flowers, and restaurants and shops are all around you and the S-Bahn at Savigny-Platz or the U-Bahn or Buses at Bahnohof Zoo are only eight minutes away by foot. This time we stayed for five nights and rooms and service are of the same good quality. Now you have good WiFi connection in your room - free. The only handicap worth mentioning is that the elevator stops only between two floors - you have always to go a flight of stairs up or down to your room, what can be a nuisance if you have any mobility problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Navajorug
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Hotel Carmer 16 for 4 nights in July, 2010, as part of a 3-week vacation in Europe celebrating his high school graduation. This hotel was one of the best places we stayed during that 3 weeks. The rooms were large, well-furnished and comfortable. Ours looked out onto Carmerstrasse, which was nice in itself. The neighborhood is quiet and pleasant, but with easy access to the Zoo/Tiergarten U-bahn, S-bahn and bus station, so all of Berlin was easily and quickly accessible to us. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We found them knowledgeable and interesting as people as well. Everyone was highly fluent in English, very helpful since my German is what I remember from 4 years in high school 35 years ago. The staff loaded us up with information, maps, brochures, and when needed could sell us transit cards, making it easy to use Berlin's excellent public transit. A special word about breakfast: it's great. Smoked salmon on rolls, fresh fruit and vegetables, but American eggs and bacon too for those who need them. Several mornings I took my pot of coffee out to the sidewalk while my son slept late, and sipped there as the world passed by. The hotel is not air conditioned. It was hot while we were there. We received fans when we checked in, and used them in the room. The heat was the only drawback of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: ASale
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel within walking distance of the main bahnhof, Only 5 minute walk to Savignyplatz passing several great cafes a long the way. Great breakfast with a few tables outside.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly anc charming”
Reviews.Author: marimur
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, welcoming staff, charming (and a bit surprisiing) layout , nice rooms :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Service”
Reviews.Author: SassyGrillz
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Rick Steves' guidebook, and it was described appropriately: "may be dated, but very charming." Staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were adequate in size and clean. Breakfast buffet had great selection. Set in a quiet neighborhood--if you're looking for hip and to be in the middle of major tourist attractions, this is not the hotel for you. However, it's close to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JJO72
Reviews.Content: This could not have worked out better. The hotel is on a quiet street within easy walking distance to bus and S-Bahn. It is in an area that is loaded with bars and restaurants. We especially liked Die Dicke Wirten and Die 12 Apostle. Our room was huge by European standards and the staff was most helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaVincent
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very small, ( 108 guess ), the breakfast was very good and the waitress in charge was very kind, as the guy at the reception in the morning,

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms - very good location”
Reviews.Author: Spikespot55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in November. The location is excellent, near to the Ku'damm and Zoo but in a quiet side street . Also next to Savignyplatz which has an excellent variety of restaurants. Would recommend the Zillemarkt (near Savignyplatz U-bahn) for echte German/Berlinisch food. And there are good bars on Kantstrasse and Savignyplatz. The rooms are very large (or at least the ones we had were) and extremely comfortable. The breakfast was self-service and included bacon, egg, etc as well as continental staples. The staff were very friendly particularly the night manager who spoke fluent English and is a mine of information about Berlin. Had a very good stay

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel in quiet and central location”
Reviews.Author: marouine
Reviews.Content: with our group we just stayed for a longer weekend at the Carmer-Nice little hotel in a central location 5 min to Kurfürstendamm, very quiet street in a safe neigbourhood, old townhouse converted to a hotel. Rooms were different in shape and size but all of them nice furnished and very clean. Friendly and helpful staff, a lot of nice and affordable places to eat and sit in the area, so after walking around in "official" Berlin and seeing the sights youcan spent the evening in one of the garden restaurants around (looking for spanish,greek,italian,belgian,indian,thai, swedish (i loved it at "Alter Schwede") oder berlin kind of cooking within 5 minutes. Breakfast in buffet style was complete and great.
